author: Yvonne Alessandro
title: Marquinhos elogia Donnarumma:
text:
Marquinhos elogia Donnarumma: "Da anni è un grande portiere per il PSG, fa la differenza"
Dopo la rimonta strepitosa del PSG contro il Manchester City (da 0-2 a 4-2), il capitano dei parigini Marquinhos ha parlato ai microfoni di Sky Sport per commentare anche la partita strepitosa di Gigio Donnarumma. Estremo difensore del Paris, in scadenza nel 2026 e dal futuro ancora da stabilire: "Quanto rimarrà al PSG Donnarumma? Gli ho detto ogni volta che usciva e che faceva una parata: 'Così ti voglio'. È un portiere che ha mostrato già che ha una potenzialità, una qualità, che anche se è grande è veloce, che poi ha questa forza. Poi sulle uscite... Lui penso che negli ultimi anni è sempre migliorato, facendo vedere che è un grande portiere per noi", ha esordito il difensore brasiliano.
Proseguendo: "È un portiere che fa la differenza, l'abbiamo visto tante volte. Oggi (ieri, ndr) è stata una bella partita, ha fatto una grande partita. È un grande amico che ho da tanti anni che siamo insieme, un grande ragazzo, una brava persona. Un professionista, è sempre stato bravissimo, voglio sempre il meglio di queste persone così, di questi giocatori così. È stato grande oggi (ieri, ndr), ha fatto molto la differenza per noi e mi aspetto che faccia ancora altre belle partite così".

author: EFE
title: Lluvias en frontera de Perú con Ecuador han afectado más de 15.000 hectáreas de cultivos - Mundo - ABC Color
text: Mundo Lluvias en frontera de Perú con Ecuador han afectado más de 15.000 hectáreas de cultivos Lima, 5 mar (EFE).- Las fuertes lluvias que caen en el departamento peruano de Tumbes, fronterizo con Ecuador, han afectado hasta el momento a más de 15.000 hectáreas de cultivos, 5.000 de las cuales ya se han perdido, informó este miércoles el ministro de Desarrollo Agrario y Riego, Ángel Manero. Por EFE 06 de marzo de 2025 - 24:37

author: Erika Hernández
title: Pareja de Nevada retenía a su hijo de 11 años con autismo dentro de una jaula y vestido solo con pañal
text:
La policía informó que una pareja de Nevada fue arrestada el martes después de que las autoridades encontraron a su hijo de 11 años con autismo retenido en una jaula de metal con manchas de heces en el piso y vestido solo con un pañal.
Los agentes de policía de Henderson fueron a la casa del niño para realizar un control de bienestar a las 10:15 am del martes por la mañana, después de que el Distrito Escolar del Condado de Clark solicitó ayuda con un “problema de ausentismo escolar” que involucraba a un estudiante que no había asistido a la escuela.
Según la policía, los agentes descubrieron que el niño de 11 años estaba “contenido dentro de un gran recinto metálico”. Además, la describieron la residencia como un lugar de “condiciones de vida inhóspitas”.
La pareja, identificada como Misty Scanlan, de 46 años, y Jeffery Scanlan, de 41, fueron arrestados y cada uno acusado de un delito grave de abuso o negligencia infantil.
Un oficial de ausentismo escolar había visitado la casa de Scanlan ese mismo día para preguntar por el niño, pero nadie respondió en la puerta. Sin embargo, el hombre informó haber escuchado a un niño gritando y una puerta traqueteando en el interior, según un informe de arresto obtenido por KSNV, afiliada de NBC.
Cuando un oficial de policía de Henderson llegó más tarde para un control de seguimiento, Jeffrey Scanlan respondió y le dijo que sus hijos estaban enfermos y le permitió entrar al oficial, informó KSNV.
Fue entonces cuando el oficial vio el recinto metálico, que describió como similar a una celda de prisión. Dentro se encontraba un niño que vestía “sólo un pañal”, mientras que el piso tenía heces , según el acta de detención.
Un detective de la Unidad de Víctimas Especiales llegó para realizar una investigación y un recorrido por la casa. Describieron las habitaciones sin muebles, basura esparcida, heces en las paredes y el piso, y habitaciones con cerraduras externas que impedían que cualquiera que estuviera dentro pudiera salir.
Jeffrey Scanlan supuestamente dijo a las autoridades que su hijo exhibía un comportamiento agresivo debido a un diagnóstico grave de trastorno del espectro autista y que el recinto metálico se utilizó como una “medida semi-punitiva cuando su comportamiento está fuera de control”, informó KSNV.
Los registros judiciales muestran que los Scanlan pagaron la fianza el miércoles y están programados para comparecer nuevamente ante el tribunal en mayo.
Sigue leyendo:
– Una mujer de Maryland prendió fuego a su hijo de 8 años porque ensució mientras comía cereal
– Padres de Pensilvania acusados de abusar físicamente de sus gemelos de un año hasta casi matarlos
– Acusan por segunda vez a una madre de Carolina del Norte de matar a su bebé mientras duerme

author: Anthony Robledo
title: Viral photo of forlorn Spiral Hot Dogs owner leads to booming business
text: Customer's photo of forlorn owner in empty restaurant leads business to boom at OK diner Nick Chappell had never been to Spirals Hot Dogs & More before he took a photo of Scott Festler in his empty restaurant. But after business boomed, Chappell's part of the Spirals family, Festler says. [Anthony Robledo](https://www.usatoday.com/staff/7612431001/anthony-robledo/) An Oklahoma hot dog joint owner visibly wanted customers one day and he soon got more than he bargained for. During a slow shift on Dec. 20, a customer took a photo of Scott Festler standing by his restaurant entrance waiting for diners and shared it on social media. Festler would soon have no time to stand around as " [Spirals: Hot Dogs & More](https://spiralshotdogs.com/)," in Norman, Oklahoma, saw booming business once the post went viral. "We immediately started doing double digits in sales," Festler told USA TODAY on Thursday. "It happened really fast to me." The day the photo was taken, Festler found himself staring out the window upset his family business of four years wasn't booming as well as others ahead of Christmas. Festler said he had no idea why Spirals saw a sudden wave of new customers after Dec. 20 until the person responsible for posting the photo, Nick Chappell, later apologized and offered to take the post down. Festler wouldn't hear of it. "You just wouldn't expect it. Social media is amazing. It's amazing that people get involved with it," he said. "But more importantly, it's the stuff that you just don't think would work. That's what works." 'I will always love you': [See Dolly Parton grant Utah man's dying wish to meet her](/story/life/humankind/2023/12/26/dolly-parton-meets-longtime-fan/72033945007/) Customer knew he had to capture 'wholesome moment' Chappell visited the Norman area for his job as an Oklahoma Army National Guard. As part of their weekly hot dog Wednesday routine, Chappell and a his co-worker found Spirals on Google Maps and took a chance. Noticing Festler gazing, Chappell decided to capture the "wholesome moment" on Snapchat captioning "He has been standing here waiting on customers to come in." "A good buddy of mine named Chad said, 'Hey, man, you can either post this on Facebook or I'm going to post this on Facebook. Some way or another we're going to get this guy some customers,'" Chappell said. In a Facebook post, Chappell gave an excellent recommendation of the restaurant, complimenting their food and "off the charts" service. He shared a photo of his dish, the menu and of Festler waiting for diners. Chappell was blown away by the success of the post, which has since had over 2,000 shares, and even more surprised to see over 70 guests at the diner during his next visit. "I'm not a huge social media guy I typically don't share," Chappell said. "I don't even know really the words to describe it as but it made me even that much happier that I did make a post." Owner adds new 'Thunderbird' item in customer's honor Festler is showing his gratitude by adding a new item in Chappell's honor. Having named hot dogs and bowls after family members, he was more than happy to do so. The "Thunderbird" is a hot link with bacon, cream cheese and jalapeños, Festler said. The meal gets its name from the Thunderbird Unit Patch for the 45th Infantry, which Chappell is a part of. The two reconnected at the restaurant on Thursday, where they both got emotional talking about the post's impact. Chappell received a certificate of appreciation during the unveiling of the "Thunderbird" and was told he is now forever part of the Spirals family. "To know that it was a humble guy that just saw our need and did what he could. He doesn’t have a real following on social media, he hardly ever shares anything and to know that one post had so much power. It was super cool," Festler added.

author: ANI
title: UP-based cow slaughtering gang busted, three accused arrested: Delhi Police
text: With the arrest of three accused, police claimed to have busted a UP-based cow-slaughtering gang active in Delhi-NCR, police said. Delhi Police Joint Team of AATS/NED and PS Karawal Nagar busted a cow slaughtering gang of Sambhal (UP) active in Delhi-NCR and solved the cow slaughtering case and arrested three accused, police said. According to the police, the apprehended accused have been identified as Wajhat alias Ajju (32), Jahane Alam alias Jahna (30), and Sajid alias Sadva (28). All the accused are residents of UPs Amroha district. A four-wheeler vehicle used in the commission of crime has also been recovered, police said. The main accused, Sajid alias Sadwa, is a notorious criminal who was caught earlier by UP Police in an encounter, and he came out of jail in July 2023. According to North East Delhi DCP Joy Tirkey, a PCR call was received in Karawal Nagar police station on December 24 informing that some severed heads of cow and other parts were found near Janki Panchal Vihar, Karawal Nagar, Delhi. Accordingly, a case under Section 429 and 424(4) of the IPC and Section 12 of the Prevention of Cruelty Against Animals Act was registered at Karawal Nagar Police Station, and an investigation was subsequently taken up. During the course of the investigation, all possible efforts were made to trace the accused persons. Several CCTV footages were analysed, and upon analysing the CCTV footage, a Honda City car was found involved in the case, police said. The route of the car was followed, and it was found that three people disembarked from the car near Seemapuri Depot, Delhi. Based on collected inputs and information, the police zeroed in on three suspected persons and succeeded in apprehending them from their rented accommodation in Old Mustafabad, Delhi. On verification, their identities were established. On sustained interrogation, the apprehended accused confessed to their crime and further disclosed that they procured the Xylaxin injections used to make cows unconscious from a chemist in Jafrabad and used to lift stray cows from various areas of Delhi-NCR. According to the police, 17 syringes and 34 needles were also recovered from their possession. All three accused persons have been found to be dreaded criminals, previously involved in more than 15 cow slaughtering cases registered in Nagli (UP), Shalimar Bagh, and Gokulpuri, while other locations are still being verified, police said.
